entry.title: Henry-Stewart talks to appear
entry.summary: URLs HS Talks, https://hstalks.com/expert/1336/dr-jing-hua-zhao/?biosci. CRAN, https://cloud.r-project.org/web/packages/gaawr2/index.html. GitHub, https://github.com/jinghuazhao/gaawr2. Web site, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/gaawr2/.

entry.title: Fresh 0.1.64 is available
entry.content: Fresh is a thoughtfully implemented and fast evolving text editor, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/fresh.html.
entry.summary: Fresh is a thoughtfully implemented and fast evolving text editor, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/fresh.html.

entry.title: Latest Firefox is built on CSD3!

link.title: Latest Firefox is built on CSD3!

entry.content:
These are detailed here, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/firefox.html.

As of 20/1/2026, we have from module avail ceuadmin/firefox:

--------------------------------------------------- /usr/local/Cluster-Config/modulefiles ----------------------------------------------------
ceuadmin/firefox/60.5.1-1.el7  ceuadmin/firefox/147.0.1  ceuadmin/firefox/148.0a1  ceuadmin/firefox/nightly

where nightly points to 148.0a1 on 19/12/2025.

Modules as of 29/9/2025,

--------------------------------------------------- /usr/local/Cluster-Config/modulefiles ---------------------------------------------------
ceuadmin/firefox/60.5.1-1.el7  ceuadmin/firefox/143.0.1  ceuadmin/firefox/143.0a1  ceuadmin/firefox/145.0a1  ceuadmin/firefox/nightly

such that

  • 60.5.1-1.el7 is actually a singularity module.
  • 143.0.1 is the first official release at ceuadmin.
  • 145.0a1 is officially nightly.
  • ceuadmin/firefox/nightly is still a symbolic link to 143.0a1.

The general context is described here, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/web.html.

A real-world usage on CSD3 is shown here, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/Caprion/.
entry.summary: These are detailed here, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/firefox.html. As of 20/1/2026, we have from module avail ceuadmin/firefox: --------------------------------------------------- /usr/local/Cluster-Config/modulefiles ---------------------------------------------------- ceuadmin/firefox/60.5.1-1.el7 ceuadmin/firefox/147.0.1 ceuadmin/firefox/148.0a1 ceuadmin/firefox/nightly where nightly points to 148.0a1 on 19/12/2025. Modules as of 29/9/2025, --------------------------------------------------- /usr/local/Cluster-Config/modulefiles --------------------------------------------------- ceuadmin/firefox/60.5.1-1.el7 ceuadmin/firefox/143.0.1 ceuadmin/firefox/143.0a1 ceuadmin/firefox/145.0a1 ceuadmin/firefox/nightly such that 60.5.1-1.el7 is actually a singularity module. 143.0.1 is the first official release at ceuadmin. 145.0a1 is officially nightly. ceuadmin/firefox/nightly is still a symbolic link to 143.0a1. The general context is described here, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/web.html. A real-world usage on CSD3 is shown here, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/Caprion/.

entry.title: Software for population genetics available
entry.content:
Besides R/rehh and simNGS (https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:simngs) earlier, this kickstarts with these modules:

  1. selscan. Haplotype based scans for selection, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/selscan.html.
  2. angsd. Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/angsd.html.
  3. Relate. Software to estimate genome-wide genealogies for thousands of samples, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/relate.html
  4. CLUES2. A method for inferring and evaluating evidence for selection, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/clues2.html.
  5. fastsimcoal2. Fast sequential Markov coalescent simulation of genomic data under complex evolutionary models, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/fsc2.html.
  6. hapstat. haplotype-disease association, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/hapstat.html.
  7. CCphylo. a software suite designed to easen phylogenetic analysis, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:ccphylo.
entry.summary: Besides R/rehh and simNGS (https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:simngs) earlier, this kickstarts with these modules: selscan. Haplotype based scans for selection, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/selscan.html. angsd. Analysis of Next Generation Sequencing Data, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/angsd.html. Relate. Software to estimate genome-wide genealogies for thousands of samples, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/relate.html CLUES2. A method for inferring and evaluating evidence for selection, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/clues2.html. fastsimcoal2. Fast sequential Markov coalescent simulation of genomic data under complex evolutionary models, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/fsc2.html. hapstat. haplotype-disease association, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/hapstat.html. CCphylo. a software suite designed to easen phylogenetic analysis, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:ccphylo.

entry.title: Sphinx, cambridge-ceu/csd3 & srcf polished
entry.content:
I am pleased to share extensions of two canonical (1 & 2 below) and a customised (3 below) themes,

1. sphinx-rtd-theme

A new repository, sphinx https://github.com/jinghuazhao/sphinx, highlights the long-awaited adoption of the theme incorporating the master logo and link.

2. jekyll-rtd-theme

Inspired by the extension above, the cambridge-ceu/csd3 site https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/ now collapses on the side bar while showing summary information on each category and giving remarkable visual simplification.

3. srcf

The SRCF-style site is showcased here, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/srcf/.
entry.summary: I am pleased to share extensions of two canonical (1 & 2 below) and a customised (3 below) themes, 1. sphinx-rtd-theme A new repository, sphinx https://github.com/jinghuazhao/sphinx, highlights the long-awaited adoption of the theme incorporating the master logo and link. 2. jekyll-rtd-theme Inspired by the extension above, the cambridge-ceu/csd3 site https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/ now collapses on the side bar while showing summary information on each category and giving remarkable visual simplification. 3. srcf The SRCF-style site is showcased here, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/srcf/.

entry.title: Tools for mtDNA analysis added
entry.content:
A summary is given in the following table,

Date Addons
2025-08-05 MToolBox/1.2.1
2025-08-10 haplogrep/2.4.0
”” haplogrep/3.2.2
2025-08-13 fNUMT/1.1
”” NUMTFinder/0.5.5
”” simNGS/1.7
2025-08-20 snakemake/9.9.0-miniforge3
2025-08-21 MitoImpute/GitHub (0.2)
2025-09-09 MitoScape/[1.0, github]
2025-09-11 mity/2.0.1

starting from MToolBox, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:mtoolbox.

entry.title: Long-read sequencing information available
entry.content:
This comprises of two aspects

  1. Software notes, https://jinghuazhao.github.io/software-notes/LRS/

  2. Benchmarks

    Date Addons
    2025-07-15 SVanalyzer/0.36
    2025-07-16 sniffles/2.2
    ”” awscli/2.27.52
    ”” SEQPower/1.1.0
    2025-07-18 truvari/5.3.0
    2025-07-19 hap.py/0.3.15
    ”” rtg-tools/3.13

    starting from SVanalyzer, https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:svanalyzer.

entry.title: Geany 2.0 & Edit 1.0.0 are featured
entry.content:
✅ ceuadmin/geany/2.0-icelake

geany for both CentOS 7 and CentOS 8 is described here,

https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/applications/geany.html

✅ ceuadmin/edit/1.0.0

edit is described here,

https://cambridge-ceu.github.io/csd3/systems/setup.html#fn:edit
